intro: Chenopodina microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is well adapted to harsh environments, with features such as succulent leaves that help store water. Chenopodina microphylla is often found in sandy soils and is an important component of local ecosystems.
